solution_line_template: Ann and Becky have worked for {hours_full_day} hours each, so both of them worked for {num_people_full_day} people * {hours_full_day} hours/person = <<{num_people_full_day}*{hours_full_day}={hours_ann_becky}>>{hours_ann_becky} hours.
All three of them, including Julia, were working for {hours_ann_becky} hours + {julia_hours} hours = {total_hours_worked} hours.

So in total, they all have served {customers_per_hour} customers/hour * {total_hours_worked} hours = <<{customers_per_hour}*{total_hours_worked}={total_customers_served}>>{total_customers_served} customers in one day.
